oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: R. E. Biggers corresondence with Raymond B. Witt, 1956 February 15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Biggers, R. E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from R. E. Biggers to Raymond B. Witt, chairman of the Board of Education in Chattanooga, Tennessee reporting on a small meeting with members of the board's Interracial Advisory Committee and "leading citizens" to discuss the public school integration. Biggers informs Witt that the group debated whether or not a court case would strengthen the board's integration policy.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education correspondence and memoranda, 1955-1957
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1953-1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
